title: Fredericksburg & Spotsylvania National Military Park: Park Research Documents
body: Explore This Park    Learn About the Park     History & Culture     Stories     The Creation of a National Park     Park Research Documents                  Park Research Documents         Chatham damaged by war NPS Image   The architectural data section of Chatham's Historic Structure Report (HSR) offers a valuable look into Chatham's original architectural design, as well as the changes which have been made throughout the home's 200 years of residential history. The report was completed in 1984, following Chatham's inclusion into the park.        Throughout its history, Chatham was both a home for the wealthy and a working farm NPS Photo   Chatham's Preliminary Historic Resource Study, compiled in 1982, provides a rich amount of information concerning the owners and residents of Chatham Manor from the 1770s to the 1970s.        Fairfield Plantation's farm office, now known as the Jackson Shrine NPS Photo   The Jackson Shrine's Historic Structure Report, compiled in 1968, provides information about the farm office of Fairfield Plantation, the place where General Stonewall Jackson died.        Veterans returned to visit Salem Church after the war NPS Photo   The Historic Structures Report Part 1 and Part 2 for Old Salem Church compiled in the 1960s, provides information about this landmark of battle during the Chancellorsville campaign.        Ellwood was a private residence well into the 20th Century NPS Photo   The Cultural Landscape Report for Ellwood on the Wilderness Battlefield provides a history of the plantation as well as an overview of existing conditions and possible future treatment.        This artistic rendition shows what the Catharine Furnace complex may have looked like in the 19th Century NPS Image   This historic resource study provides a history of Catharine Furnace, the ruins of which are visible on the Chancellorsville Battlefield.
